tool.name: QCMerger
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && echo ARGS && cat '$args_json' && echo HARD && cat '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("qcml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("qcml")}' '$out' #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: List of qcml files to be merged

param.name: setname
param.label: Use only when all given qcml files belong to one set, which will be held under the given name

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
Merges two qcml files together.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_QCMerger.html
